author: parithosh
content: pinned message has been updated with the fixed reth image as well as latest the grandine image

author: parithosh
content:
Any objections with launching devnet 5 tomorrow?

It seems we're close to all the hive tests passing and the bugs we find now don't seem to be major.

I'll set the network split based on what clients seem most stable/pass most hive tests and then we can add more validators after the fact.

If anyone wants me to use images or branches not in the pinned post, then please let me know by tomorrow

author: terencechain
content: <@199561711278227457> can you take the commit from latest prysm develop? for devnet5 ill look into the reth issue now

author: parithosh
content: Ofc! And feel free to change the image config posted in the bug channel. Perhaps updating to develop already fixes it.

author: siladu
content: We still have a pretty signficant EIP-7623 change in flight which might impact a lot of txs. Hoping to get it merged in next 24 hours. Will do some more interop testing today as well to see if anything is broken on our main branch.

author: jochembrouwer
content: I would suggest to wait for ACDE. Also this PR got opened for BLS today: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9245 which changes the gas schedule of BLS

author: jochembrouwer
content: Not sure if that PR would be intended to be part of devnet-5 though

author: jochembrouwer
content: Actually thinking about it, I'm not sure: did we have a devnet-5 spec freeze already? Or am I now just imagining things?

author: siladu
content: if no objections, makes sense to include that in devnet5 IMO as it's such a small change. We are implementing it now (but will hold off merging until ACD)

author: jochembrouwer
content: The change is small, but this would technically require a new release of EEST which will take some time to fill and then tests clients on, so I think including it would "delay" devnet-5 to Friday (which is fine by me)

author: siladu
content: If clients were devnet5-ready before this change, I don't see any reason to wait for EEST release. Would be nice to have the passing suite though ðŸ™‚

author: jochembrouwer
content: Yeah ok I see, in this case it should just be changing a constant. But for completeness would be nice to have an updated suite then ðŸ™‚ But yeah I agree in this case waiting for the fixture release is not 100% necessary
